Package jason.stdlib

Class drop_intention

  • java.lang.Object
    • jason.asSemantics.DefaultInternalAction
      • jason.stdlib.drop_intention
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InternalAction, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    drop_desire
    public class drop_intention
extends DefaultInternalAction

    Internal action: .drop_intention(I).

    Description: removes intentions to achieve goal I from the set of intentions of the agent (suspended intentions are also considered). No event is produced.

    Example:

    • .drop_intention(go(1,3)): removes an intention having a plan with triggering event +!go(1,3) in the agent's current circumstance.
    • .drop_intention: removes the current intention.
    See Also:
    intend, desire, drop_all_desires, drop_all_events, drop_all_intentions, drop_desire, succeed_goal, fail_goal, current_intention, suspend, suspended, resume, Serialized Form

      • execute

        public java.lang.Object execute​(TransitionSystem ts,
                                Unifier un,
                                Term[] args)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: InternalAction
        Executes the internal action. It should return a Boolean or an Iterator. A true boolean return means that the IA was successfully executed. An Iterator result means that there is more than one answer for this IA (e.g. see member internal action).
